sentence.Network_en: When my mother died I was inconsolable.
sentence.Network_cn: 母亲去世的时候，我悲恸万分。

sentence.Network_en: They were inconsolable when their only child died.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们唯一的孩子去世时，他们简直痛不欲生。

sentence.Network_en: She is inconsolable for the loss of her husband.
sentence.Network_cn: 她因失去丈夫而痛不欲生[忧伤不已].

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from French, or from Latin inconsolabilis, from in- 'not' + consolabilis 'able to be consoled', from the verb consolari (see console)

entry.tran: 悲恸至极的;伤心欲绝的;极度沮丧的
entry.def: If you say that someone is inconsolable, you mean that they are very sad and cannot be comforted.

example.ex: When my mother died I was inconsolable.
example.tran: 母亲去世的时候,我悲恸万分。

means.word_mean: 1. sad beyond comforting; incapable of being consoled;
